SEARCH
Package io.avery.conveyor

Interface Belt.Source<Out>

Type Parameters:
Out - the output element type
All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Belt.Stage
All Known Subinterfaces:
Belt.StepSource<Out>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ProxySource
Enclosing class:
Belt
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public static non-sealed interface Belt.Source<Out> extends Belt.Stage, AutoCloseable
A Stage that yields output elements.

A source may enclose an upstream station, which will run when the source runs. Sources generally should be run before yielding elements, in case the source connects across an upstream boundary, to avoid the effects of unmitigated buffer depletion (including potential deadlock).

This is a functional interface whose functional method is drainToSink(StepSink).

    run

  • Method Details

    • drainToSink

      boolean drainToSink(Belt.StepSink<? super Out> sink) throws Exception
      Pushes as many elements as possible from this source to the sink. This proceeds until either an exception is thrown, this source is drained, or this source is unable to push more elements to the sink (which does not necessarily mean the sink cancelled). Returns false if the sink definitely cancelled, meaning a call to push returned false; else returns true.
      Parameters:
      sink - the sink to drain to
      Returns:
      false if the sink cancelled
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to drain
      Implementation Requirements
      Implementors should restrict to pushing to the sink. Completing the sink is the caller's responsibility, as the sink may be reused after this method is called.

      Implementors should document if they concurrently push to the sink, as this is not safe for all sinks.

    • close

      default void close() throws Exception
      Relinquishes any underlying resources held by this source.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to close
      Implementation Requirements
      Calling this method may cause this source to stop yielding elements from pull and drainToSink. In that case, if this is a linked boundary source, the linked boundary sink should implement its push and drainFromSource methods to discard elements and return false after this method is called, to prevent unbounded buffering or deadlock.

      A source that delegates to upstream sources should call close on each upstream source before returning from this method, even if this method throws. If closing any source throws an exception, subsequent exceptions should be suppressed onto the first exception. The utility method Belts.composedClose(Stream) is provided for common use cases.

      The default implementation does nothing.

    • forEach

      default void forEach(Consumer<? super Out> action) throws Exception
      Performs the given action for each remaining element of the source. This proceeds until either an exception is thrown, this source is drained, or this source is unable to push more elements to the Consumer.
      Parameters:
      action - the action to be performed for each element
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to drain

    • collect

      default <A, R> R collect(Collector<? super Out,A,R> collector) throws Exception
      Performs a mutable reduction operation on the remaining elements of this source using a Collector. This proceeds until either an exception is thrown, this source is drained, or this source is unable to push more elements to the Collector.
      Type Parameters:
      A - the intermediate accumulation type of the Collector
      R - the type of the result
      Parameters:
      collector - the Collector describing the reduction
      Returns:
      the result of the reduction
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to drain
      See Also:
      • Stream.collect(Collector)

    • compose

      default Belt.Source<Out> compose(Belt.Station upstream)
      Connects the upstream station before this source. Returns a new source that behaves like this source, except that running it will also run the upstream station.
      Parameters:
      upstream - the upstream station
      Returns:
      a new source that also runs an upstream station
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if upstream is null
